Key Arguments: The legislation could lead to censorship of everyday Australians, stifling free speech and open discussion.
It poses a risk of leading Australia towards a dictatorship by enforcing a one-sided narrative.
The legislation is seen as draconian and not suitable for a free and civil society.
There is concern about who will oversee the implementation and the potential for abuse of power.
The bill could suppress diverse voices and promote propaganda.
There is a lack of safety mechanisms to prevent misuse by those with ulterior motives.
Main Themes: Importance of diverse voices and open discussion
Notable Quotes: This Bill will lead us into a one-way road to dictatorship.
We do not want propaganda to thrive, we need all voices not just one voice.
These discussions are the lifeblood of democracy and diplomacy nurturing, understanding, progress and unity.
